Level 1 Description: Program prompts the user for three numbers. This may be a single prompt that asks for three numbers or it may be three separate prompts.
Level 2 Description: Programs prompts for one or two numbers or includes an incorrect attempt to prompt for numbers.

Level 1 Description: Program converts all three numbers entered by the user from strings to ints or floats.
Level 2 Description: Program converts one or two numbers or includes an incorrect attempt to convert the numbers.

Criterion: 3. Program calculates the correct tire volume
Level 1 Description: Program calculates the correct tire volume.
Level 2 Description: Program calculates a volume that is incorrect.

Criterion: 4. Program prints the volume with 0, 1, or 2 digits after decimal
Level 1 Description: Program prints the tire volume to the terminal window with no more than two digits after the decimal point.
Level 2 Description: Program prints the volume with more than two digits after the decimal point.
Program includes an incorrect attempt to import datetime.

Level 1 Description: Program gets the current date from the computer's operating system.
Level 2 Description: Program includes some code to import datetime or get the current date, but the code doesn't work.

Level 1 Description: Program opens the volumes.txt file for appending text.
Level 2 Description: Program opens the volumes.txt file in any mode except appending text (e.g., reading, writing with truncate).

Criterion: 8. Program prints the current date to volumes.txt
Level 1 Description: Program prints the current date to the volumes.txt file in the exact format: YYYY-MM-DD.
Level 2 Description: Program prints the current date to the volumes.txt file in any other format.

Criterion: 9. Program prints width, aspect ratio, diameter, and volume
Level 1 Description: Program prints the width, aspect ratio, diameter, and volume, properly formatted, to the volumes.txt file.
Level 2 Description: Program prints only some of the required values or values improperly formatted to the volumes.txt file.

Level 1 Description: Additional features were added to the program.
Level 3 Description: Additional features were not added to the program.
